verses.verse: A <S%H8605>Prayer<s%> of the <S%H6041>afflicted<s%>, when he is <S%H5848>overwhelmed<s%>, and poureth <S%H8210>out<s%> his <S%H7879>complaint<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>. <S%H8085>Hear<s%> my <S%H8605>prayer<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and let my <S%H7775>cry<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> unto thee. of: or, for

<S%H5641>Hide<s%> not thy <S%H6440>face<s%> from me in the <S%H3117>day<s%> when I am in <S%H6862>trouble<s%>; <S%H5186>incline<s%> thine <S%H241>ear<s%> unto me: in the <S%H3117>day<s%> when I <S%H7121>call<s%> <S%H6030>answer<s%> me <S%H4118>speedily<s%>.
For my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H3615>consumed<s%> like <S%H6227>smoke<s%>, and my <S%H6106>bones<s%> are <S%H2787>burned<s%> as an <S%H4168>hearth<s%>. like: or, (as some read) into smoke
My <S%H3820>heart<s%> is <S%H5221>smitten<s%>, and <S%H3001>withered<s%> like <S%H6212>grass<s%>; so that I <S%H7911>forget<s%> to <S%H398>eat<s%> my <S%H3899>bread<s%>.
By reason of the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H585>groaning<s%> my <S%H6106>bones<s%> <S%H1692>cleave<s%> to my <S%H1320>skin<s%>. skin: or, flesh
I am <S%H1819>like<s%> a <S%H6893>pelican<s%> of the <S%H4057>wilderness<s%>: I am like an <S%H3563>owl<s%> of the <S%H2723>desert<s%>.
I <S%H8245>watch<s%>, and am as a <S%H6833>sparrow<s%> <S%H909>alone<s%> upon the house <S%H1406>top<s%>.
Mine <S%H341>enemies<s%> <S%H2778>reproach<s%> me all the <S%H3117>day<s%>; and they that are <S%H1984>mad<s%> against me are <S%H7650>sworn<s%> against me.
For I have <S%H398>eaten<s%> <S%H665>ashes<s%> like <S%H3899>bread<s%>, and <S%H4537>mingled<s%> my <S%H8249>drink<s%> with <S%H1065>weeping<s%>,
<S%H6440>Because<s%> of thine <S%H2195>indignation<s%> and thy <S%H7110>wrath<s%>: for thou hast lifted me <S%H5375>up<s%>, and cast me <S%H7993>down<s%>.
My <S%H3117>days<s%> are like a <S%H6738>shadow<s%> that <S%H5186>declineth<s%>; and I am <S%H3001>withered<s%> like <S%H6212>grass<s%>.
But thou, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, shalt <S%H3427>endure<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>; and thy <S%H2143>remembrance<s%> unto <S%H1755>all<s%> <S%H1755>generations<s%>.
Thou shalt <S%H6965>arise<s%>, and have <S%H7355>mercy<s%> upon <S%H6726>Zion<s%>: for the <S%H6256>time<s%> to <S%H2603>favour<s%> her, yea, the set <S%H4150>time<s%>, is <S%H935>come<s%>.
For thy <S%H5650>servants<s%> take <S%H7521>pleasure<s%> in her <S%H68>stones<s%>, and <S%H2603>favour<s%> the <S%H6083>dust<s%> thereof.
So the <S%H1471>heathen<s%> shall <S%H3372>fear<s%> the <S%H8034>name<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and all the <S%H4428>kings<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%> thy <S%H3519>glory<s%>.
When the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall build <S%H1129>up<s%> <S%H6726>Zion<s%>, he shall <S%H7200>appear<s%> in his <S%H3519>glory<s%>.
He will <S%H6437>regard<s%> the <S%H8605>prayer<s%> of the <S%H6199>destitute<s%>, and not <S%H959>despise<s%> their <S%H8605>prayer<s%>.

This shall be <S%H3789>written<s%> for the <S%H1755>generation<s%> to <S%H314>come<s%>: and the <S%H5971>people<s%> which shall be <S%H1254>created<s%> shall <S%H1984>praise<s%> the <S%H3050>LORD<s%>.
For he hath looked <S%H8259>down<s%> from the <S%H4791>height<s%> of his <S%H6944>sanctuary<s%>; from <S%H8064>heaven<s%> did the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H5027>behold<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%>;
To <S%H8085>hear<s%> the <S%H603>groaning<s%> of the <S%H615>prisoner<s%>; to <S%H6605>loose<s%> those that are <S%H1121>appointed<s%> to <S%H8546>death<s%>; those: Heb. the children of death
To <S%H5608>declare<s%> the <S%H8034>name<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> in <S%H6726>Zion<s%>, and his <S%H8416>praise<s%> in <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>;
When the <S%H5971>people<s%> are <S%H6908>gathered<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%>, and the <S%H4467>kingdoms<s%>, to <S%H5647>serve<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
He <S%H6031>weakened<s%> my <S%H3581>strength<s%> in the <S%H1870>way<s%>; he <S%H7114>shortened<s%> my <S%H3117>days<s%>. weakened: Heb. afflicted

I <S%H559>said<s%>, O my <S%H410>God<s%>, take me not <S%H5927>away<s%> in the <S%H2677>midst<s%> of my <S%H3117>days<s%>: thy <S%H8141>years<s%> are throughout <S%H1755>all<s%> <S%H1755>generations<s%>.
Of <S%H6440>old<s%> hast thou laid the <S%H3245>foundation<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>: and the <S%H8064>heavens<s%> are the <S%H4639>work<s%> of thy <S%H3027>hands<s%>.

They shall <S%H6>perish<s%>, but thou shalt <S%H5975>endure<s%>: yea, all of them shall wax <S%H1086>old<s%> like a <S%H899>garment<s%>; as a <S%H3830>vesture<s%> shalt thou <S%H2498>change<s%> them, and they shall be <S%H2498>changed<s%>: endure: Heb. stand
But thou art the same, and thy <S%H8141>years<s%> shall have no <S%H8552>end<s%>.
The <S%H1121>children<s%> of thy <S%H5650>servants<s%> shall <S%H7931>continue<s%>, and their <S%H2233>seed<s%> shall be <S%H3559>established<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> thee.
